intro: Senecio chiquianensis, commonly known as the Chiquian groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in rocky soils and open landscapes. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
